On Wed, 28 Jan 2004 19:03:39 -0500, Ron Jeffries 
<ronjeffries@...> wrote:

> On Wednesday, January 28, 2004, at 6:05:27 PM, mona ahuja wrote:
>
>> I have a question if I have a method in a class which calls 2 other 
>> methods of the same class. How do
>> unit test this method.How do I check if its passing correct parameters 
>> to other methods. eg
>> method XYZ()
>> {
>> int x;
>> int y;
>> aa(x);
>> bb(y);
>> }
>> aa() ,bb(),XYZ() are all methods of the same class.
>> I can unit test aa() and bb()in isolation but how do I test that methos 
>> XYZ is passing correct values tp
>> aa and bb
>
> It depends. Show us the methods.

While that is a true statement, another (slightly more practical?) 
statement may be, "calling XYZ must produce some measurable side-effect, 
otherwise you wouldn't have the method, so test for the side effect".

-- 
Jason Rogers
